result.execSummary:
The defendant Shauniqua C Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work, school and child care. Good time allowed.

miscConds.notes: No controlled substances or alcohol; urine screens. No driving without a valid driver's license or without insurance.
Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED. Seek and maintain employment.  Job and vocational training.  Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements; pay supervision fees.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dishchargable in bankruptcy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shauniqua C Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Parties request a separate sentencing date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Shauniqua C Johnson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

/submitted by the State, received and filed, charging defendant as follows:
Carrying Concealed Weapon, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 941.23(2).

Defendant Shauniqua C Johnson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Court granted same and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant is compliant. rn

Defendant Shauniqua C Johnson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/28/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shauniqua C Johnson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Shauniqua C Johnson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
